metadata.title: CVE-2023-1326 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A privilege escalation attack was found in apport-cli 2.26.0 and earlierwhich is similar to CVE-2023-26604. If a system is specially configured toallow unprivileged users to run sudo apport-cli, less is configured as thepager, and the terminal size can be set: a local attacker can escalateprivilege. It is extremely unlikely that a system administrator wouldconfigure sudo to allow unprivileged users to perform this class ofexploit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu27.26').
